column4: hello there, anyone know how to make work the bcm43xx drivers?
anyone? wireless bcm4318
I would also recommend ndiswrapper.  I had no luck with fwcutter
you may have wrong drivers then
if no luck with the others try https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/bcm43xx/Feisty_No-Fluff
i tried the methods according my card and doesn't work, I've used the same drivers with feisty before and worked well but the signal was only 50% tops
I don't actually use ubuntu but if you could upgrad your kernel to 2.6.24 (if ubuntu does not use that version) they have better support
use ndiswrapper from source by the way
also compiled ndiswrapper before
deleted the /etc/ndiswrapper files, recompiled from tarball,
what does ndiswrapper -l list?
if that is fine could you post your dmesg to the paste board
do you have the bc43 module blacklisted?
sorry b43 i mean
din, i'll reboot and back to tell you guys if werks
checked out my paste
did you get it?
